Class HousingUnit

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.HousingUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MainCockpitComp, ModularHousingUnit
public abstract class HousingUnit extends Component
Represents an abstract housing unit within a tile-based game board. HousingUnit serves as a component that can hold crew members, alien types, and support connectivity with nearby housing units. The HousingUnit manages state and behavior related to its position on a player board, the presence of humans/aliens, adjacent units, and interactions with other game components.
See Also:

      public abstract void notifyUnit(boolean type, HousingUnit unit)
      Notifies a specific housing unit of a certain type of event or update.
      Parameters:
      type - A boolean indicating the type of notification. If true, it signifies a certain action (e.g., adding a crew).
      unit - The HousingUnit object that is being notified.

    • kill

      Returns:
      an integer representing the result or outcome of the kill operation, which could denote success, remaining units, or other implementation-specific values.

    • accept

      public abstract void accept(ComponentAction visitor, PlayerState State)
      Accepts a visitor object to perform an operation on the HousingUnit component following the visitor design pattern. This method enables external operations to be performed on the component without modifying its structure, facilitating flexibility and modularity.
      Overrides:
      accept in class Component
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ComponentAction visitor that performs a specific action on this component
      State - the current PlayerState representing the state of the player interacting with the component

    • isPopulated

      public boolean isPopulated()
      Determines whether the housing unit is populated based on the presence of humans or specific alien species.
      Returns:
      true if the housing unit contains at least one human, a brown alien, or a purple alien; false otherwise.

    • checkNearbyUnits

      public void checkNearbyUnits(PlayerBoard pb)
      Checks for nearby housing units that are populated and establishes connections to these units if certain conditions are met. The method considers the player's board setup and evaluates whether nearby tiles are connected or contain valid housing units.
      Parameters:
      pb - the player board object that contains housing units, their configurations, and methods to check connections between tiles
